case_name_full: The People of the State of New York v. Michael Davis

opinions.opinion_text:
— Appeal by the defendant from a judgment of the Supreme Court, Richmond County (Sangiorgio, J.), rendered December 29, 1983, convicting him of burglary in the second degree, upon his plea of guilty, and imposing sentence.
Judgment affirmed.
We have reviewed the record and agree with the defendant’s assigned counsel that there are no meritorious issues which could be raised on appeal. Counsel’s application for leave to withdraw as counsel is granted (see, Anders v California, 386 US 738; People v Paige, 54 AD2d 631; cf. People v Gonzalez, 47 NY2d 606). Lazer, J. P., Bracken, Brown, Lawrence and Kooper, JJ., concur.

court_short_name: Appellate Division of the Supreme Court of New York
court_full_name: Appellate Division of the Supreme Court of the State of New York
